revised_title: Oxidation of Organic Sulphides: Interaction of Hydroperoxides with Unsaturated Sulphides
tldr: The article investigates the reaction between hydroperoxides and unsaturated sulphides, focusing on the interaction between i-butyl hydroperoxide and two unsaturated sulphides. The reactions in alcohol solvents show similar features to those observed for saturated sulphides, while in benzene, the reaction with i-butyl hydroperoxide leads to a non-quantitative yield of sulphoxide. The study provides insights into the reaction mechanism and the role of unsaturated sulphides as free radical inhibitors, which has implications for their autoxidation characteristics.
